title: Sydney property prices
body:
Are terrible right now.

Like it is a legit social issue.

A whole generation using >50% of their total income endebted to the bank to pay off a place they cant afford because property prices have been jacked up in a perfect storm of price insanity from unrestrained overseas capital to local policies like FHOG and NG.

That same generation will have less discretionary income to spend, impacting a host of other sectors (retail, tourism, etc etc) and will base decisions to have children on their financial situation, either putting off the choice until later or worse, permanently.

And if we have a crash, the arse will fall out of the economy in a HUGE way because the banking sector is propped up by mortgage repayments. Developers wont build, tradesmen will go out of work, and banks will shed thousands of staff.

The party cant last forever, and the barman is calling last drinks.

Hold on kids - the next 10 years are gonna be interesting.

replies.body:
Its because offshore investors buy 2-4 propertys adjacent to each other, rip down the houses and put flats up, there making a ton of money so they dont mind paying the inflated prices.

Rip owning my own house.

Our generation has to remember this struggle we are going through and try to bring in universal land taxes. Say you had a ULT set at 1% which is very fair to someone who only owns the home they live in. If their property is worth $100,000 they'd pay $1000 per year and on the other end someone with $10,000,000 worth of property would pay $100,000 per year. This would put most people off investing in property freeing up affordable housing for future generations. Also it would mean the government wouldn't need to tax you as much for income and gst. So saving money to buy your home would become easier. People who own a home would have more money to spend. The economy would grow due to increased spending. Right now there is a small percentage that benefits form the current system.
